newsitem.title: FRANCE: StGobain to halve Suez stake - paper.
newsitem.headline: StGobain to halve Suez stake - paper.

text.p: French building materials group Saint-Gobain plans to halve its stake in holding company Cie de Suez, newspaper Le Monde reported on Tuesday.

"On completion of the merger (between Suez and Lyonnaise des Eaux ) Saint-Gobain is thinking of halving its holding," the newspaper quoted chairman Jean-Louis Beffa as saying on the margins of an analysts' meeting.

A company spokeswoman declined to confirmed what percentage of its Suez stake would be sold. It currently owns 6.29 percent. Beffa earlier said Saint-Gobain would reduce its stakes held through share cross-holdings.
Earlier, a company spokesman said the reduction in cross-holdings would be "notably in a line of Suez."
Saint-Gobain holds stakes in Cie Generale des Eaux, Banque Nationale de Paris (BNP) and Axa-UAP which are part of its group of stable shareholders.

Saint-Gobain is considering reducing its stake in all these companies, as part of its strategy of viewing them as financial investments, the spokesman said. Only lens-maker Essilor was not under review, as Saint-Gobain regards it as an industrial investment, he said.
"We must have a vision of profitability" on share cross-holdings, Beffa told analysts. The group would reduce its stakes this year, he added.
